images.caption: Figure 2:The superiority of the DiT-based method over the U-Net-based one and the side effects of IP-Adapter¬†(IPA)[54].

Figure 3:The main framework of InfiniteYou (InfU) and the detailed architecture of InfuseNet. The projected identity features and an optional control image are injected by InfuseNet into text-to-image DiTs via residual connections. Specifically, each DiT block in InfuseNet predicts the output residuals of the correspondingiùëñiitalic_iDiT blocks in the base model. Only InfuseNet and the projection network are trainable.
Figure 4:The introduced multi-stage training strategy with synthetic single-person-multiple-sample (SPMS) data and supervised fine-tuning (SFT).
Figure 5:Qualitative comparison results of InfU with the state-of-the-art baselines, FLUX.1-dev IP-Adapter[20]and PuLID-FLUX[14].
Figure 6:Desirable plug-and-play properties of InfU, compatible with many popular methods and plugins.
